text:
I have a servlet that sets up some cookies the have spaces in the value.  The 
cookie is set ok (I can watch a packet trace to verify this) and the cookie is 
sent back from the browser properly (again verified via packet trace), however 
the value that my servlet gets is truncated at the first space.  This same 
servlet runs succesfully under Tomcat 3.2.3 and Tomcat 4.0.1.

text:
Patch looks good - I checked the spec and it's a bit strange ( it says spaces are allowed between tokens, and my previous interpretation was that name and value are each 'token', not that value is composed from tokens ). However it can be read both ways - and accepting spaces in unquoted values should be fine.

Version 0 ( original ) cookies explicitely reject spaces in name/value. In V1 quotes could be used as well, as a workaround ( but we don't add quotes by default because some browsers may not like them ).

+1 on commiting the patch ( if Larry is ok with that, of course ).
